Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, Hi youngatheart, I've done no 3 out of 15 today. I decided to go for using the Aveeno after my shower in the end.  I figured that it was 3 hours until treatment.  I hope that it was the right thing! I got the R1 and R2 on prescription from the doctor.  I apply the R1 immediately after. When I got home I applied another thin layer and left it uncovered for 15 minutes.  It made me even later for work, but never mind eh! Good Luck to everyone! Jules xx
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Himaggieme, It definitely makes me wonder with the cream before as it does say not to use R2 before treatment.  I did mention that I had used the Aveeno and my girls said that was fine.  Such conflicting information isn't helpful is it!I I was already suffering with shooting pains prior to starting the radiotherapy, but on Thursday they felt worse and also in a more widespread area.  I just think the Rads may have irritated an existing problem or maybe even paranoia! It's definitely been less of an issue today, so who knows.  Hi Leolady56, I'm only 2 days in at the moment.  I'm using R1 and R2, so haven't used Aloe Vera yet.  I was keeping that in mind for back up.  Yesterday, my skin felt prickly and flushed but it looked normal.  Fingers crossed! It definitely feels better today.   I would really welcome feedback on the R1 and R2 creams as requested in my other post if any one can help? Thank You! Jules xx
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I didn't want to but I started my rads on Thursday.  I didn't have tattoo's, ive got pen marks instead.  They've also got me a vest to wear during treatment, so at least I still have my dignity. I've managed to get R1 and R2 on prescription, it wasn't easy but I was persistent and got it in the end.  I could do with some advice with the gel/ cream if anyone can help.  I put the R1 gel on straight after treatment on the 1st day and covered it with a cotton hanky.  By the time I got home it was completely stuck to my skin. Yesterday, I did the same but wet the hanky, it was slightly better but still I would be happier if it came away easier.  What has everyone else done?   I am finding that one sachet of the R2 cream isn't really sufficient, and I'm not very big,  how many has everyone else used? I'm concerned that I won't have enough. My appointments are all early, and as you're not supposed to use the R2 cream before treatment, yesterday I put Aveeno on after my shower.  I let them know that I had put cream on and they said that was fine.  Is this ok, or should I not use anything?  I started reacting after my 1st session with shooting pains and yesterday my skin felt really prickly and flushed.  I jeke checking it as I was expecting it to be bright red! Many Thanks Terrified Jules!
Posts.Title: October 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hello, So I rang the oncology department this morning, I got some right shirty wench on the end of the phone.  She said that the appointment was just to discuss my treatment and there wouldn't be any procedures.  I asked if the doctor was male or female and if they would need to examine me.  She told me that it was a male and yes he would want to examine me.  So now I'm waiting for another appointment with a female doctor.  That's all fine with me for now.  I'll keep at massaging the scar tissue in the meantime.  I now have lumps bigger than any lump that was removed! and OMG it hurts! Hope all you lovelies are ok? ️
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Hope you're all well? I've been trying to get the R1 and R2 cream on prescription.  My doctor's can't find it.  Is it known as anything else? I gave them the PIP codes but that didn't help. Many thanks Julia x
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi, On Thursday, after 4 long weeks of waiting, I received the results from my op. All clear margins, not in my lymph nodes and no chemo! Yay!  So now after 13 long weeks i feel like it's time to move on from 'Waiting for Results' I'm now waiting for radiotherapy and the joys of tamoxifen and then getting back to living my life and I'm hoping that,th th will be without change. I'm struggling with body image issues at the moment. I'm hoping that some point in the not too distant future, that will be rectified too. I'm scared about radiotherapy and I'm scared about tamoxifen, so it's all possibly going to get a bit bumpy along the way!
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi Israel, Thank you so much. That's really encouraging.  What did you use to moisturise with?  Hugs back at you! xx
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Thank you! I'd seen something about that cream, I couldn't remember what it was.  I have to go to the doctor's this week, I'll write it down and ask about it. I've also been told to use Aveeno and Aloe Vera. Happy Sunday!
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi Liz, I bet that's taken some energy!  I think my brain and my mouth have forgotten to engage today, and I don't even have an excuse at the moment! Let us know how you get on tomorrow J x
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone ️ I don't know what's going on with them.  I was on the internet while they were on the phone, telling them that they were Watermelon Technologies.  She was just saying 'its not coming up on our system'.  She said that they'd been into the pharmacy next door and they didn't know what it was either.  I gave them the PIP codes when I ordered, so I don't know what to do.  She advised me to try an alternative pharmacy.  Ive printed out a letter from the website and some other stuff. Watch this space! Jules x
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi Granny 59, Hello and pleased to meet you! I'm a big wuss and am scared of everything!  I'm apparently a little bit weird in the way I've dealt with my diagnosis... Not entirely sure why. I feel completely normal.  So heads up, if I come out with something a bit radical and different to the norm.  I just have certain issues lol! Huge hugs back to you, look forward to chatting with you
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi Bluebell22, Now you have the kind of cancer that makes me feel like    ' what the hell do I need to worry about!' prior to Thursday I had managed to convince myself that I would be the same. Whilst I know that it's not all doom and gloom, I realise it's a bit more complicated than having tamoxifen.  I've been moaning like crazy about that, but have come to realise that I'm one of the lucky ones!  Oh jeez, I hope that comes across in the right sentiment! If I've put my foot in it, PLEASE educate me! Hope to chat about stuff! Hugs to you xx
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief, I was just on their website. I'm definitely going to ask my doctor about this.  Hopefully with my body image issues, she'll be kind to me. Lactose I'm ok with, but gluten is another issue lol. Happy Sunday! Jules x
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hi my lovelies, After putting off starting Tamoxifen since October, I finally took the plunge and started it on Saturday night. Sunday I was fine, no issues. Yesterday was horrendous, really bad acid, headache, dizzy, pains in legs, rash, I just felt dreadful. I decided to not take last night's tablet and took it this morning instead.  I took the tablet at 10am and by 3pm I was suffering with the headaches again. As the evening is going on, I seem to be developing the pains in my legs again.   I didn't expect to start having symptoms so soon. I really don't know if I can continue if I feel this awful after 3 tablets.  I'm not even on full dose, I've only been taking 10mg. Would love to hear your experiences.. Jules ️
Posts.Title: Tamoxibollocks
